name: Cassiodorus
summary: Cassiodorus was a Roman statesman, scholar, and monk who served under Theodoric the Great and his successors. After retiring from public life, he founded the monastery of Vivarium, where he established a scriptorium for copying manuscripts. His work helped preserve classical learning during the transition from antiquity to the Middle Ages. He wrote extensively on history, theology, and education.

writings.title: Institutions of Divine and Secular Learning
